dyimagefx

Class MyImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • dyimagefx.MyImage

  • public class MyImage
extends java.lang.Object
    File: MyImage.java Description: This file contains MyImage class which is used to create image object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyImage()
      Default constructor
      MyImage(int width, int height)
      Constructor to create a new image object
      MyImage(MyImage img)
      Constructor to create a copy of a previously created image object.

        public void writeImage(java.lang.String filePath)
        Write the content of the BufferedImage object 'image' to a file
        Parameters:

      • isEqual

        public boolean isEqual(MyImage img)
        This method will check for equality of two images. If we have two image img1 and img2 Then calling img1.isEqual(img2) will return TRUE if img1 and img2 are equal else it will return FALSE.
        Parameters:
        img - The image to check with.
        Returns:
        TRUE if two images are equal else FALSE.

      • getAlpha

        public int getAlpha(int x,
           int y)
        This method will return the amount of alpha value between 0-255 at the pixel (x,y)
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        the amount of alpha (transparency) 0 means transparent 255 means opaque

      • getRed

        public int getRed(int x,
         int y)
        This method will return the amount of red value between 0-255 at the pixel (x,y)
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        the amount of red 0 means none 255 means fully red

        y - the y coordinate of the pixel
        alpha - the alpha value to set [value from 0-255]
        red - the red value to set [value from 0-255]

      • HSI_getHue

        public double HSI_getHue(int x,
                int y)
        This method will return the hue of the pixel (x,y) as per HSI color model.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the pixel.
        y - The y coordinate of the pixel.
        Returns:
        H The hue value of the pixel [0-360] in degree.
